intro: Kobresia harrysmithii, commonly known as the Harry Smith's kobresia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. This plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with dense, compact foliage. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Kobresia harrysmithii is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it an important component of desert ecosystems.
